etymology.description: 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") right + 止(止) (zhǐ, "foot") left = footsteps in divergent directions
etymology.interpretation: The character 癶(bō) visually represents two feet pointing outwards, symbolizing movement in different or divergent directions. This contrasts with 舛(chuǎn), where the feet point towards each other, indicating convergence.

examples.chinese: 他走路时的癶声回荡在夜空(他走路時的癶聲回蕩在夜空)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒulù shí de bō shēng huídàng zài yèkōng.
examples.english: The sound of his footsteps echoed in the night sky.

examples.chinese: 夜深人静时(夜深人靜時)，我听见远处的癶声(我聽見遠處的癶聲)。
examples.pinyin: Yè shēn rén jìng shí, wǒ tīngjiàn yuǎn chù de bō shēng.
examples.english: In the still of the night, I heard the footsteps from afar.

examples.chinese: 踏入古寺前院(踏入古寺前院)，便能听到历史中遗留的癶声(便能聽到歷史中遺留的癶聲)。
examples.pinyin: Tà rù gǔ sì qián yuàn, biàn néng tīngdào lìshǐ zhōng yíliú de bō shēng.
examples.english: Upon entering the ancient monastery courtyard, one could hear the lingering footsteps of history.
